Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, hands down”
Reviews.Author: Jason T
Reviews.Content: I come to San Diego every other month for work. Over the years, I've stay at many hotels throughout the Sorrento Valley area. My favorite is the doubletree in del mar. I stay here every time I come to San Diego for business and for relaxation. In fact, I am writing this review from its room right now. 1) Easy access to the freeway. 5, 805, 56. 2) Close to the Torrey Pines reserve and the beaches 3) Several shopping plazas with restaurants nearby 4) Free Parking 5) Clean, modern rooms, just completed renovation months 6) Beautiful outdoor patio to relax with a drink. Next to the outdoor pool and jacuzzi 7) Excellent on premise restaurant, quality breakfast buffet 8) Great service 9) Free warm chocolate chip cookie

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eli09Ca
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. It's in a good location, close to the fairgrounds and just minutes from the beach. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Delmar Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: seadog22
Reviews.Content: Standard Doubletree hotel in a good location next to the I-5 in Delmar. Access can be tricky trying to find your way from the freeway to the hotel due to street layout. Front desk was very friendly and efficent, room was clean, beds were comfortable and we noticed a number of dogs staying with owners, probably due to the pet friendly rules.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel in San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: Richard R
Reviews.Content: We've been to this property numerous times over the past few years. Great location, beautiful pool and helpful staff make this hotel our "go to" property in the San Diego area....plus, free parking!!

Reviews.Title: “A Full Can of Cookies, No Points”
Reviews.Author: Interested01
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at this hotel about ten years ago, the overpowering smell of weed from the next room, along with a few other annoyances, almost sent me packing. This time I was greeted with a smile and half a dozen Doubletree Cookies. The breakfast was good and the bed super comfortable. The prepaid rate was a bargain. No problems. Until a couple of weeks later when I found out I hadn't been credited with the stay. The hotel told me I'd been marked as a no-show. Several phone calls to the hotel and Hilton Honors still haven't resolved this. I probably gained two pounds from eating those cookies. Maybe if I showed them my waistline... Assuming they take care of the glitch, I'd recommend the hotel. It's right across the street from the Hampton Inn San Diego/Del Mar, so all the driving destinations I mentioned in that review are convenient. If the rates were close to the same, I would choose this one over the Hampton, especially if you're a Hilton Diamond member.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jennnnn
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised at the pretty decor and high level of service at this hotel. My room looked to be fairly newly decorated and was spotless. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. The breakfast buffet was good as far as buffets go; tried appetizers at the bar which were also good. The outdoor pool area is resort-like and there is an area for outdoor dining, too. We were able to get a complimentary chocolate chip cookie or cup of coffee almost any time and the staff was quite friendly. All in all this was a great value and much more than I would have expected at this price level!

Reviews.Title: “Nice chain property.”
Reviews.Author: HungaryHippo
Reviews.Content: Staff was nice. Room was fine...modern. It was not close to anything but there is a shuttle and the young guys at night were nice and gave tips on where to eat. Older white male shuttle driver during day made me uncomfortable. Not sure why he felt the need to tell me he is not embarrassed to take tips. If that is an issue for him a little discreet sign in the van would be more appropriate. Breakfast was good but omlette station was not ready until 30 min. after opening. Gym was good. Pool looked nice but it was chilly that morning. Well kept hotel better for business than leisure. About 3 miles from Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel Close To Everything”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan19866
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Priceline for under $75 and with that being said I must say I was pleasantly surprised.with the spacious room and modern facilities. The room looks like it was recently renovated. Staff was very friendly at check in. There is a nice bar downstairs which was open still at 12am. The hotel is conveniently located to the 5 freeway which is great if you need to head either North or South. Across the road is a shopping center with a large VONS grocery store that is open till midnight. There is a restaurant on the property, with several within walking distance. If you need a central location it is great, however it is not really close to any particular local attraction. It is about 10 minutes to ocean via car. Overall very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: 65cocow65
Reviews.Content: It took more than one hour for the front desk just answered me a simple question when I checked in the same time with a group of football players. That woman was so busy flirting with all those football guys and degraded me completely. Worst personalty I ever see. Will never come back again even it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2momCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. This is a second time we stay here. Every time is a pleasure. Rooms been renovated. Beds are very comfortable. Hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. And do not forget free parking and warm cookies. Will defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: David293922
Reviews.Content: When my wife woke up in the morning the first thing she said was that there was one great thing that she really appreciated about the hotel, besides the wonderful and comfortable beds, and that was that it was always completely silent- no traffic sounds or any other disturbances. And we were the closet room to the elevator. Another reviewer said the exact opposite, which quite surprised me. For me every detail was great about the room. Lots of space, flat screen tv, many many pillows, completely clean. It was the least distance from my car to the room I've ever had with a hotel with an elevator. I had about 7 interactions with employees there, especially various people in housekeeping, and everyone of them was very pleasant and positive and helpful. That's rare most of the time. The pool was heated enough and the hot tub was very hot with plenty of towels made available. It's an awesome pool area. The only negative aspect I found was that beer was $4.00 during happy hour. I suppose that would make the stock holders happy, but not really any customers. A side note: If you've never eaten at Soup Plantation, do so. It is exactly three short blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room in hotel with beautiful garden setting”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELERPAPA
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to like in this hotel including: beautiful grounds and well-kept gardens; wonderful, large, clean swimming pool; and comfortable beds; friendly receptionists; yummy cookies on arrival. However three noises in the room were a big distraction to me: a loud hum in the bathroom vent; a noisy heater & air conditioner; and noisy traffic from the adjacent freeway. Overall service was good, but when I went for a swim in the morning, there were no towels at the pool (The hotel instruction manual in the room said these would be there.). I told a maintenance person who said he would see to it promptly. When we left the hotel 1.5 hours later, there were still no towels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property.”
Reviews.Author: storewanderer
Reviews.Content: I had a really nice stay here. I got a freshly remodeled corner room; the room was average in size but very functional and comfortable. Check in was very good and parking was easy (and free). It is a little far from the beach and such, but, near a lot of freeways. There isn't too much in the way of food immediately nearby, but if you go a few minutes away there are many choices. Overall it was a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with Dog”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: I specifically chose this place because they allow dogs. I think they put all the pets on the same floor because we ran into a couple of other dog owners. There's a little "potty area" in front of the hotel which was a convenient. The hotel is located in a business park so it its empty on the weekend. The dog got to run around. Anyways, this is a very comfortable hotel. Free parking, cookies at check-in, a nice bar/outdoor lounge area. The pool and Jacuzzi was clean. There was a bar-mitvah going on when we stayed but it wasn't loud. The hotel is located about a 10 minute drive to the Del Mar Dog beach. I think we were in a standard room and there was a couch, a desk, and a very comfortable bed. Booked through Hilton Honors and the staff was nice. Not that the rooms are loud but you can hear people open and close doors.

Reviews.Title: “Best value mid-scale hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights around Christmas. Being a business hotel, it gives drastic discount (nearly 50% off on priceline bid) on weekends and holidays. It is very conveniently located just off I-5. Going to attraction like Sea Word takes roughly 10-15 minutes. The room is standard size with very comfortable bed. I love the shower a lot. It gives quite impressive water pressure. These days, a lot of hotels are trying to be conservative and replace their shower head to limit the water volume. But this doubletree does not disappoint me on that. We had no problem with the hotel at all during our stay. There is a small fitness room with adequate equipments to burn your extra energy. There is no free WiFi in room, unless you are Gold and above with HHonor and not book through priceline/hotwire (the frontdesk staff is well informed about it). Nonetheless, you can have free WiFi in the lobby. A microwave oven is provided near the frontdesk for your convenience (for the popcorns they sell, but they will let you use). Overall, I would recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers. Del Mar downtown is only about 2 miles away where quite a lot dining options are available. Four-leg friends are allowed (maybe for a fee).

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: tawfiqsibani
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Del Mar; beautiful city on the beach to start with. Checked into the hotel on a weekend. The smiles from the front desk agents made my heart feel like I was home; along with it came the warm chocolate cookies and the speedy check in; took the front desk agent less than 2 minutes and we had the keys in out hands. Our room had the pool view and my family was so happy. Went down to the pool with the kids and It was heated one. They even had towels at the pool. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant. The staff were extremely friendly and the manager was a very kind young man. The food tasted delicious and it sounded music to my ears for myself and my family. As we were checking out I was sad to leave but I made a promise to myself if I do come back this is the place that I would be staying at. THIS PLACE IS HEAVEN ON EARTH.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mike g
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently for business and am always satisfied. They take care of Diamond Members and typically give an upgrade to a jr. suite or suite. The hotel is typically not overly crowded, the gym is adequate and the restaurant is actually really good. Free shuttle to downtown del mar for all the restaurants on the water. Great bar staff, Kristi is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best part was the pool”
Reviews.Author: Astrodog614
Reviews.Content: This hotel for the most part is nice, especially the heated pool and spa. Our first night was spent in a room that smelled like rotten eggs though. We checked in sort of late so I figured I would not complain at that hour so I just opened the window. It took care of the problem until I smelled steak cooking from the restaurant down below. At least that was better! By the morning the smell was back and the hallway smelled funny too. I think I'll go back to my standby Hampton Inn in Carlsbad. Even the breakfast comes free with your room there and you can go grab coffee anytime or make it in your room. Doubletree wants to a la carte you to death for everything--breakfast, coffee, internet, etc. They really had a nice patio area where the pool is but maybe I can live without that.

Reviews.Title: “Not guest-oriented”
Reviews.Author: anita w
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in one of the suites and had one of the most disappointing experiences : 1) no free wifi 2) one hook in the entire bathroom (including vanity area). Plus the hook was right next to the tub and so shallow that it couldn't hold anything without it slipping off. 3) The "blanket" on the fold out sofa was like a piece of packing foam. 4) No microwave or small fridge in the "suite",. 5) The coffee maker is at the end of the entrance hall as far away as possible from good lighting or the dining table. 6) The room service breakfast was a fiasco - cold scrambled eggs, lukewarm coffee, cold potatoes. Plus they forgot the bagel and I had to call room service to remind them. Plus the food was terrible. 7) They advertise that the windows open but they open barely a crack and are extremely difficult to open. 8) No complimentary newspapers(!) 9) When we arrived (around 4:00pm) there was a pile of discarded silverware outside our door. 10) There was a bottle of spring water waiting in the room with a $3.50 price tag prominently and tackily dsplayed . Gee, Hilton, thanks for the hospitality. 11) Couldn't figure out the heating/cooling system and there were no instructions. I've stayed in a lot of hotels but have never seen anything so confusing. 12) Tiny sink area in the bathroom. You'd think with a suite that there would be double sinks but there was just one. Just a very cold and unwelcoming experience overall. I saw quite a few guests with pets (we brought our dog) and I can only conclude that this hotel stays in business because they have a captive audience of pet owners who want to stay at a recognized chain.

Reviews.Title: “Try Finding Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on December 17. After checking into hotel, we went out to a wedding and didn't come back until around midnight. When we left our room earlier, we had set the temperature at 72 ad it was an unusually cold night for San Diego area. When we came back the room was drafty and cold and in fact the heating unit (which I assume works also as air conditioner) was blowing out cold air. We messed around with the setting, but couldn't get it work properly. We then called the from desk and asked for help. They told us that they had no technical personnel available at that time of the night, but promised to send us additional blankets as there were none in the room. They never sent the blankets and we decided it was useless trying. Just promised ourselves never to stay at a Hilton or a Doubletree (run by Hilton) again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Good Staff, Good Restaurant (Road Warrior view)”
Reviews.Author: yellowpixels
Reviews.Content: It was a toss up between the Doubletree and the Hampton Inn (essentially next to each other). Last minute business trip to San Diego. Hotel turned out to be a great choice. The rooms are very comfortable - mine overlooked the pool and was quiet. The restaurant was surprisingly good for both breakfast (buffet plus cooked to order eggs) and the dinner. It really was an unexpected bonus to be able to get food that good in the hotel. Good shower (for those of you who care this one had water pressure ... ) My only minor nit is that the TV remote did not have a sleep timer button. I would recommend and return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for San Diego Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler155
Reviews.Content: Free parking, nicely decorated rooms, and good value. The property is a couple of blocks from the 5 with lots of good restaurants within a 5 mile radius. It backs to a very busy road, so ask for a room on the front side of the property if you are a light sleeper. Also, do not stay close to the elevator, which for some reason, is quite noisy. The staff are friendly and helpful. This is an excellent choice for the San Diego business traveler who does NOT want to stay in hotel circle--the drive into San Diego is not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, reasonable on the weekends.”
Reviews.Author: Ali432
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a weekend stay at this location that is well situated near La Jolla, Del Mar, and the coast. The hotel is located off the highway in a small corporate park area. The rooms were clean, contemporary, and comfortable - the staff were gracious and helpful. The dining room and breakfast were a bit lackluster as we did not have silverware, the buffet was on the lean side, coffee running low, etc. - but nothing huge. Overall the hotel provided us with a positive stay - we hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, will return to this hotel when in the area.”
Reviews.Author: mdhinder
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel and was treated like a queen. The room was beautifully decorated and had a full on view of the courtyard/pool area. The outdoor area was outstanding with so many different areas to relax. I loved the sofas outdoors with fireplaces. The service was excellent from the moment I checked in at the desk thru to my last breakfast the day I checked out. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet which gives you the opportunity to also order an omelette or fresh eggs if you chose. The hotel guest appeared to be mostly business travelers and therefore was quiet and offered many networking opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “No Laundry Service. No Washer/ dryer”
Reviews.Author: B- T
Reviews.Content: Does not have any ability to handle guests laundry - even though the guest literature says it does. It's not that the washer was out of order, there is none. The front desk directs you to laundromat a drive away. LAME.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I got a great deal for this through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: gafiltafish
Reviews.Content: My stay at the DoubleTree was better than I expected. I placed a bid on Priceline hoping to get the Courtyard in Solana Beach, but got this hotel instead. Was a bit disappointed since Solana Beach has a bit more going on and how that hotel included wifi in the bedrooms. In any case I got a nice hotel in a nice area for a great rate of $58 and change a night including taxes. I was very happy that when I called to request early check in how the operator stated I could come at anytime and the room would be ready. I usually expect to maybe get a room 2 hours at the earliest, but was able to check in hours earlier. Parking is free, and check in.check out was fast and easy. They gave me the cookie without even bringing it up. I have a sweet tooth and yes their chocolate chip cookies are delicious. I just wish there was a tray of them in the lobby or a different worker there so that I wouldn’t have them thinking I was a pig (I only had 4 during my 1 night trip). Service was fine, but I rarely had to talk to anyone about anything anyway. My room was smaller than I expect it to be, but the bed was comfortable. The only problem that I had with the room was that in order to get hot water to come out of the sink, I would have to turn the tub on to the hottest seating for a minute, turn that off, than go back to the sink and then hot water would come out. I was also able to hear a bit of the freeway noise from my room, so that could be a problem with someone who cannot sleep with any noise. It also would have been nice to have had a little fridge in the room, but for 1 night I didn't need it. The amenities I saw included a nice pool and Jacuzzi opened until 10 or 11PM. I wanted to use the Jacuzzi, but never did. Despite the fact that you have to pay $10 to get wifi in your room, it is free on the ground floor so I spent a little bit of time in the sports bar to go online. It is a bit of an inconvenience not to have the internet be complimentary in your room since these days we rely on it so much (and no I don’t want to spend extra money for a breakfast and internet package in case management is reading this hah). They have a large restaurant too (never ate there), but around dinner time I only saw one person eating there. A few people did make use of the sports bar area since it was Sunday night football time and the bar’s happy hour (beer and appetizers were at reasonable prices until 7). The surrounding area of the hotel is interesting because it seems to be largely in a business area with large office buildings surrounding the hotel. Nothing is within a few minutes walk except for an AM PM. I was familiar with the location of the hotel since I did live in San Diego for a year. It’s in a very affluent part of San Diego with a lot of families, shopping, and restaurants. Everything you could possibly need is within a 5 minute drive, and there is also a complimentary van that will take you to nearby places if you don’t have a car. All in all I had a nice, one night stay. I probably would have been a bit disappointed in the hotel had I spent the regular price, but since I spent less than $60 the price was right. Wouldn’t have a problem returning if I got the hotel for the same price. Not having wifi in the room was a bit annoying like what other reviewers said, but not getting a complimentary breakfast wasn’t a big deal to me. Similar hotels don’t offer a breakfast either (unless you had a certain package) and when some do have it, it really is very, very continental with just your usual cereal, breads, coffee, and bananas. $16 for a breakfast buffet at a hotel actually doesn’t seem to be that much for a hotel restaurant. In any case I would rather save a bit of money rather than spending a few dollars more just for a cup of coffee, a bagel, and a banana. There are plenty of places of all different price ranges from Starbuck’s to upscale restaurants for breakfast within a 10 minute drive of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: CdelP
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego quite a bit for business and stayed in various hotels around the Del Mar area. This rates a 3-star for the breakfast, their cookies and clean rooms. The beds are not as comfortable as others I've been in. The registration staff do not remember you even if you've stayed there quite a few times. They also take pets... which could be a good thing if you are looking for a hotel that takes pets. Sadly, when you are staying for business, the last thing you need is to be in a room next to a yipping dog.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: pamal100
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, clean, comfortable beds and convenient to UC San Diego. Would stay there again, no problem. Very short 7 hr overnight stay, so did not use any of the amenities or restaurant. Quick on off from highway.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of extra Fees added on to the rate.”
Reviews.Author: Soki816
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent. It's what you'd expect from a 3-star chain. The problem is the consistent fees these types of hotels charge. The Internet is $10/day. I've stayed at three other hotels within a few miles that all offer free Internet. Breakfast is also $16/day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms, great customer service, but no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lcacds
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree Del Mar. The room has tasteful modern decor. There's a nice coffee maker in the room with GOOD coffee. The bed is super comfortable and the towels in the bath room is actually of good quality. The pool is nice, bigger than most 3 star hotels. The staff are super helpful. Since I was there on a not so busy day, they let me check in early and check out late. THe only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that I had to pay $10 for the internet, and breakfast is not included. But doesn't matter, I think I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: JayNZ63
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay here while on business in San Diego. The hotel is comfortable and quiet. There are many good restaurants and stores within walking distance. Also some good trail runs or a walk/run on the beach nearby. Also has a decent workout room and nice pool area. A good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “****Service beyond compare!!!****”
Reviews.Author: d80schild
Reviews.Content: I 'live' at the Double Tree Del Mar every week this year, from April 2011 to the present day, and I must tell you Richard Sandoval, GM, and his entire staff TRULY BELIEVE IN CUSTOMER SERVICE. They make it a point to get to know you by name, your preferences and provide you with quality customer service. When Del Mar was impacted by the blackout last Thursday, September 8, 2011, Richard and his staff were onsight, getting us prepared with flashlights, serving food that was available and ensuring everyone was safe. My colleagues and I had to fly out the next day and the San Diego airport was closed. Richard called his colleague at the Double Tree LAX and he had rooms waiting for us after we drove 1.5-2 hrs from San Diego to LA. Richard did not have to do this, but the pride he takes in the Double Tree brand and the care of his patrons truly shows his committment to service! I will ALWAYS use the Double Tree Del Mar for this service beyond compare! And HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL WITHOUT RESERVATION. You will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: morenmsunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently at the same time there was a convention going on for "unschoolers" (not home schoolers - who would have possibly behaved a lot better!) and their families. Thankfully we had activities planned each day so we left the hotel early in the morning and didn't arrive back until later in the evening. Otherwise we would have left because there were children were running up and down the halls, abusing the elevators and in the lobby and pool area - totally unsupervised. That is not our idea of a vacation at the nice hotel. The staff was friendly. The rooms were thankfully very quiet and nice and the location is very good - away from the freeways but easy access to them. The pool area is nice. We used the computers in the business office several times - there was no charge. We made our reservations online and had no idea what was also happening at the hotel. I think the chances of another one of those types of conventions is highly unlikely, but next time we'll call the hotel directly to make sure. Because of all the chaos, we did not eat any meals in the hotel. We found an Einstein's bagels and a Starbucks nearby, and also a Von's grocery store just a few blocks up the street where we got snacks and cold drinks. There is also a Souplantation in the same vicinity as the Von's.

Reviews.Title: “Tired of being nickled and dimed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFieldGuy
Reviews.Content: Of the 16 or so hotels we used on our recent tour of the American West, this is the ONLY ONE where Internet was not free, and one of only 3 or 4 where breakfast was not included. At the Doubletree Del Mar, the WiFi was $10. and the breakfast $16. Do yourself a favor: stay at a lower end hotel and get these services for free. What is going on here is that the higher end hotels are feeling squeezed by the current bad times, and are trying to recover some of their declining profits after they've hooked you with a low room rate. If you are sufficiently privileged in their frequent guest program, they might waive these fees, but despite staying at a Hilton for about 7 weeks in 2009, my Hilton status was not sufficient in this case. I believe it is time for the higher tier hotels to realize that they need to offer real, compelling value, or we will go elsewhere. For this to happen, we need to vote with our feet and our wallets. Ask yourself this: just how much time will you be staying in the swishy lobby and swishy room, and is this worth the added expense? If you are traveling for business, you will probably be too busy. And in a town like San Diego with its beaches, attractions, restaurants, and night life, why would you want to linger in any hotel?! So do yourself a favor and stay someplace cheaper that throws in all the goodies, and send the industry a message! In the interest of full disclosure, the room we had was gorgeous and large. I estimate we had a total of two and a half waking hours in it during our one day stay. My wife would also like me to point out that this is the first hotel we have ever seen that has separate recycling trash cans in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Remodeled Rooms = Nice!”
Reviews.Author: John V
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful day at Del Mar Racetrack we were ready for a hotel offering both comfort and convenience. We scored on both counts at this newly remodeled gem just outside of Solana Beach. The room decor and appointments were fresh and very clean, while the hotel's location just a short drive from several restaurant clusters gave us a choice of dining options. Will definitely come back on future SD visits!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great location and price”
Reviews.Author: dandfbud
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great - a very good location - close to La Jolla, Del Mar, surrounding golf courses. Also very close to Torrey Pines State Beach. Hotel room was spacious, modern and clean. Had small fitness center but who wants to be inside when you are in this part of California. Hot tub was too small, but pool area and restaurant were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok- definitely not a "resort"”
Reviews.Author: julieod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just for one night to catch a flight out. It is pretty no frills- no bellman- had to wait for a luggage cart (late at night). The worst part was a rattly air conditioner that kept us up all night. When I complained in the morning- they only gave us "free breakfast" instead of taking something off of our room which annoyed me. While it seems to bill itself as a resort- the property is in a business park and the pool area is very small. It was fine for what it was- at a reasonable rate and free parking but I wouldn't stay for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst i have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: talis1115
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel has to be the worst i have ever encountered. I arrived on the 1st August in the mid morning after a 14 hour flight. When i got to the counter the 2 people behind the counter just looked and kept talking in a language other then English and just made me wait. They were chatting and laughing. I was then served by the female on duty who was just incredibly rude and snooty. The pool area is the only thing this hotel has going for it. The rooms are average with terrible air conditioning. The food was always cool when it arrived from room service. I expected much better. The males behind the counter were always very friendly but the women were just not suited to service roles and they always looked messy. Don't let the name Hilton in the title fool you, this is nowhere near the standard that most Hiltons are. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PetalumaTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree August 2-4. We went down to San Diego to visit my Father-in-law who lives in Carlsbad. After spending alot of time checking rates in the Carlsbad area and finding most of them VERY expensive, I found a great online rate for the Doubletree in Del Mar. It was a prepaid, non-refundable rate, but it saved us a couple of hundred dollars each night. It was only about 10 miles from Carlsbad and we had a rental car, so it was fine. The hotel is not on the beach, which is probably why it is more reasonable. It is right off the freeway, but we didn't notice any traffic noise. The room was very nice and looked like it had been recently updated. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet and clean. The fitness center was small, but adequate. All the equipment was working and I used it both mornings we were there. There were two computers in the business center and they both worked and internet was free (I don't have a laptop or a "smart phone", so I appreciate free internet!) I thought the staff was very friendly and efficient. Check in went smoothly; our room was ready and we didn't have to rush to check out (noon). The pool area is very nice. I went into the bar and asked for a couple of cups of ice water and they were happy to give it to me and even helped with the door going back out to the pool. Overall, a very pleasant stay and a very nice hotel. A good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Back Soon!”
Reviews.Author: billynbirdy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I liked this hotel very much. We were there for one night as part of a relaxing weekend getaway. We enjoyed the fact that it was very quiet and out of sight kind of. Downtown San Diego is just about 15 minutes away on the 5 South.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice gone bad!”
Reviews.Author: cmonWinwithme
Reviews.Content: The appearance of the hotel throughout is nice. It has the look of a small resort. Pool and patio area were very clean and relaxing. We had a great breakfast. I thought the food was great and prices were fair. However my biggest complaint and disappointment was the uncleanliness of both beds in our room and the noise coming from the room next door. There was a large group of college students and the noise was out of control. The noise I understand is not the fault of the hotel. However we should of been placed in a room away from this group. Both issues made our stay very unpleasant. The hotel mgr was professional and very considerate and he did adjust our room rate due to our unfortunate experience.

Reviews.Title: “No reservation”
Reviews.Author: jtheocc
Reviews.Content: Me and my family were planning our very first trip to Southern California since moiving to California in 2009. Our first destination was Legoland and since the nearby hotels were a little pricey we opted for a hotel a little farther out. We liked the idea of staying at the Doubletree in Del Mar. Afterall, what could go wrong with staying at a great brand name of Doubletree which happens to be backed by Hilton. We made our reseveration a week ahead of arrival. Well when I got to the front desk my reservation was gone. It was as if it never happened. I had 2 tired kids and my wife's back was hurting from the 7 hour drive from Northern California. To make that matter worst all the hotels in Del Mar were booked except for the Clarion which we immediately booked. The Doubletree let us down and we will not be using them in the future. If you are going to overbook please have the courtesy of calling the guest ahead of time and making different arrangement. I highly reccommend anyone staying at Doubletree Hotel San Diego/Del Mar double check their reservation before arrival. I am not one for surprises and I am sure you aren't either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel - with one bad and one exceptional employee”
Reviews.Author: finiky2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a full week on business. The rooms are quite nice. They even offer "pure" rooms, which I would be willing to try next time. The room was a bit stuffy, as the bathrooms do not have a vent. However, I do recall that the windows to the room opened. The hotel has a large pool, small work out room, and medium size restaurant. Some of the equipment in the workout room did not work and the treadmills could use some refurbishing. Nevertheless, they were free and I used them almost every day. The hotel provides free headsets for the exercise equipment TVs, but no cleaning supplies to wipe down the equipment. The hotel offers free warm cookies upon arrival - not a perk that I care about. I'd rather have a breakfast coupon, which they obviously provided to some guest. Several in my group said they received them and they weren't even Hilton members. Some guest were even giving them away in the elevators as they had too many and couldn't use them. When I asked about the coupons to management, they said that they had made some mistakes when distributing them to guest. Speaking of breakfast, the hotel buffet breakfast was quite pricey and the area can get crowded. There was a wide variety of dishes. On a good day, I'd recommend breakfast on the terrace and ordering a la carte. There was one particular waitress whose name I think was Becky. She was exceptionally cheerful and provided great service on the mornings that I visited the restaurant. The location is great and has easy access to I-5 and is about 20 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from downtown Del Mar. You can also get to Del Mar by taking the back roads and avoid I-5. Great option. There are several grocery stores - VONS, Ralph, a Rite Aide and other shopping and dining centers nearby. I'd recommend going to the Marriott hotel across the street for dinner. The group I was with had one bad experience. Pedro who worked the front desk and also served as the hotel's shuttle driver was assigned to drive our group to the office each morning. Although I had a rental car (parking is free!), I elected to go with the group each morning. One morning, he was running late checking in guest. We had to tell him three times that we were ready. Although the meeting location was less than 10 minutes away from the hotel we didn't want to be late. The group complained about his driving that day. He drove very fast, made sharp turns and speeding over the office parking lot bumps -- with 15 people in the van. Some people complained loudly in the shuttle about the driving as he had not driven that way on previous mornings. It did not have any affect on him. We assumed he was upset with our reminders that we were late. Either way, I would never use their shuttle service again and would recommend to management that they not permit him to drive in the future. Our group asked that we mention it to management so I did. Management said that they would address the issue. There is a business center, however, the computers had to be rebooted several times. Their software obviously had some glitches. However, I was able to confirm my flight and boarding without any problems Despite this, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree --great stay”
Reviews.Author: lauraflirt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while at a nearby conference. Nice rooms, clean, modern, very comfortable. Took previous reviewers advice and grabbed dinner at the Happy Hour because I was too tired to go out, great deal. Only thing that would make it perfect would be free Wi-Fi in the room, only free in the public areas. You do need a car because it's not walking distance to attractions. You won't go wrong on this property.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great spot”
Reviews.Author: Rampart51
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a decent sized pool - sometimes with a few families frolicking in the pool and other times completely empty. Does have a lot of convention/business work so sometimes seems a bit overloaded at the hotel (lobby and bar areas) but overall quite quiet and relaxing. Renovations are currently ongoing; we stayed a week and never noticed it. The person complaining about lack of food choices must have been blind as there are two malls within 3 blocks of the hotel with great choices - Red Robin and a nice Thai place were two favorites with us. Best Mexican food we have had in a while 5 minuites away in Del mar (El Diablo). Very high food prices in bar/restaurant but chicken wings are highly addictive ($12 a plate) and if ordered at lunch beside the pool do come with fries. Location of the hotel is great - Legoland/Outlet Malls 15 min north; San Diego 15-20 min south. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Caroline090
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Doubletree while attending a golf tournament. The hotel is very clean, the beds very comfortable and the front desk staff were very accomodating. We ate in the restaurant frequently, spent a few afternoons at the pool and took advantage of the free shuttle. Would definately stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Rogerdob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really very nice. We had a very pleasant stay here. The hotel feels new and clean. The pool area is nice. However, I didn't really care for the location. It is located in a business park, so there are no restaurants or stores (except for a mini-mart) nearby. You have to drive everywhere...and in San Diego the traffic is horrendous during their extended rush hour (I live in Los Angeles and their traffic is worse!). The hotel is near the freeway so be prepared to hear traffic by the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rather-B-travelling
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Del Mar is a good mix of personal detail with the feel of a large resort style hotel. The outdoor pool area is a great place to relax and enjoy ameal or drink. The location is so so, not a lot around that area but was convienent to my business venue. Thye do provide a free shuttle however within a certain distince of the hotel. The rooms are getting an upgrade which will enhance the overall experience, but currently the room contained everything you need and was clean and comfortable. I'm not a fan however of the in-room air conditioning systems which can be noisy when turning on and off. All the staff where helpful and welcoming. Not a bad place to stay at all and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief I don't feel I have to sanitize the whole room”
Reviews.Author: isaiah41
Reviews.Content: We love staying at this hotel because it's clean, great location, friendly staff, nice pool with towels. There was false alarm fire evacuation, the two ladies sales staffs talked with us and we felt home away from home because they are so friendly. I do have two suggestions. Please post the nuts contained in your cookies. I have a 4 year old whom I've trained not to eat cookies since they may contain nuts. But lots of kids aren't like that and it can be fatal. So pls post it on your counter instead of just the small prints on the package. Second, since you are remodelling, if you could please designate dog free rooms because currently dogs are allowed in all your rooms. Just like smoke free room, a dog free room would be nice. We hope to come back again soon. My boys love the swimming pool. It's also near our favorite soup plantation restaurant. Can't get better than that!

Reviews.Title: “This place is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DaFazz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stayed at the Doubletree. The staff was incredibly nice and the hotel is beautiful. Their pool is probably the nicest around. A large pool, smaller pool for the kiddies and a hot tub. At night, you can sit in the pool area and they have these cool gas fire pits that really create a nice atmosphere. The restaurant is a bit pricey but there are so many other restaurants to visit in the area. (Try the "Good on Ya" cafe right across the parking lot) And the area is absolutely beautiful. Don't miss Torrey Pines - a very short drive from the hotel. You're close to the 5 and can get to anywhere you want to go in a minute. We will definitely return to the Doubletree. They are remodeling the entire hotel (which was a bit noisy at times, but still no big deal) so I can't imagine how nice this place is going to look when we return. Beds are extremely comfortable - the place is clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “nice not fancy”
Reviews.Author: johnjones8558
Reviews.Content: I would defintely go back since teh price and location were great. Just off the ocean, and a quick drive to everything. Would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Does not value loyal customers”
Reviews.Author: vagabond_biker
Reviews.Content: I fully understand that booking through a third party like Priceline will not get you any points toward your Hilton Honors account. But most Hilton properties will still honor your HH Gold or Platinum status at check-in with perks such as free wifi or breakfast. This property does not. Worse, if you present your HH card, it will be returned and you are told it is of no value. Fortunately it is rare for a Hilton property to treat their loyal HH members this way. When it does happen, I want it to be known. I've given this hotel an excellent rating as the property is just fine and my opinion on this issue should not lower their rating.

Reviews.Title: “Be ware your stay! If you have nuts allergy.”
Reviews.Author: EllaP168
Reviews.Content: We stay there last weekend with two kids for our Legoland trip. It's really a life lesson for us. One of our kids has nuts allergy. When we check in around 9:00pm they give us some cookies. I take it with me to our room, then the bad thing happened after a hours later. My allergy kid ate half of that chocolate chip cookies without looking at the package. （I guess she/me was so exciting about the trip and TV...just forgot to check the lable) Then, she start to cough, vomiting, wheezing...then we when to the ER. Anyway, that was her fist Anaphylaxis shock. After that, I checked the label and see a small line about the ingredient of that cookie---they has "walnuts" inside. I must say it's a really nice place to stay but not for peanut/nuts allergy people. Because they give their guest nuts product and I guess most of the people will have it inside their room. That means you'll exposure to nuts any place with your stay. Other then that cookie it really a good hotel. Nice location, friendly, nice looking pool (no time to enjoy). I hope they can put bigger sign on the counter to give a warning or just kindly ask when they giving out the warm cookies. Or maybe just give the cookie without nuts. Will that be more friendly for all the people?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rabiar
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for around five nights on a vacation to San Diego. While it's pretty far from downtown San Diego, it's close to some Del Mar shopping and restaurants. There's a beach nearby as well as Torrey Pine Reserves. Wi-fi is free only in the lobby which is a pain. Office center can be used to surf the web- printer wasn't working. They have a nice looking pool which we didn't use given that it was winter. they also have a fitness center. Clean rooms, clean bathrooms (with weird sliding door). We found a really great rate on priceline. I don't think this hotel would be worth more than 110/night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good service, relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: RcwWong
Reviews.Content: Doubletree hotels are more for business people. I travelled with my family, but we still enjoyed our stay. The staff are very welcoming and helpful and the breakfast buffet is delicious. The rooms are kept clean and very new, and the decoration of common areas is not fancy, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: mimishoe
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here last minute due to a remodel at our house down the street. We were very happy with the hotel. Family of 4 fit in the room easily. Very clean. Updated. Room was quiet. Beds were comfy. Super friendly staff. Great room rate. Easy and free parking. Charging for internet seems outdated. On-site restaurant was great. The morning breakfast buffet has everything one would expect. Enjoyed the pool, hot tub and the fire pit. We ended up staying a second night and felt like we were on vacation. Switched to a PUR room because wanted to see what it was like. It cost a little bit more, but the big difference was an air purifier in the room. We liked this room. The kids wanted to stay about 3 more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scooter20to
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Doubletree was overall good. There were a few things that I thought would have made this a 5 star review. Ladies you will understand this, I had NO full length mirror in the my room at all. I struggled to see which shoes looked right with which outfit. I don't think I've stay at a hotel of this caliber that did not have a long mirror? I was very disapointed. The room was clean and the grounds were very nice. We enjoyed the many amenities there, like the jazzuzi and fitness room. The bed was extremely comfortable and is the most important thing for me when I look into staying at a hotel. Internet was high, but becuase of a great veterens rate we opted to use it while we were there. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Home Base for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: VerbalCurrency
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in Del Mar for two nights during a business trip in October. Pros: -Rooms. Clean and well appointed. Bed was comfortable and double blinds sealed out all light from the adjacent parking lot. Nice, spacious bathroom. -Bar/Restaurant. Despite alternatives within driving distance, we ended up back at the Doubletree bar both nights of our visit. The food is good and the multiple large TV's indoors and gas fireplace tables on the patio make it an appealing spot to hang out and enjoy some drinks. Our waiters and bartenders were friendly and made us feel at home. -Location. The Doubletree was very close to to our client site and convenient to Route 5, so getting to and from the airport was easy. A car is required to get to the beach, or shopping and dining. Cons: -Lack of free internet in rooms. This is just inexcusable and a big reason why I dinged the hotel on value. Both the wired and wi-fi options in the room are $10/day. -Elevator outage. The Doubletree has two elevators, but one was out of service for the three days we stayed. This meant LONG waits for the one operating elevator and overcrowding, particularly in the morning. At five stories, the property really needs both elevators operational and I'm hopeful that service was restored following our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sheg
Reviews.Content: A MAJOR Priceline BARGAIN. Beyond a bargain.......the hotel, the service, the room, the bed....all excellent.....A bit away from the beaches, but in the end I am glad we didn't stay anywhere else. A very nice bar/restaurant, great pool with very plush towels, nice fitness center, free fresh coffee in the lobby. Upgraded to a PUR room....TOTALLY WORTH IT. The room was VERY clean and I had zero problems with my asthma. FREE parking. VERY pleasant front desk and restaurant staff. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. PS the cookes AND the apples were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, and Amazing Service!!”
Reviews.Author: zdwyer
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving this location the parking lot was spacious, clean and well lit. The front dest agents were helpful, and quick w/the fresh cookies for me and my family. The room was more than we expected. The bedding, and pillows were extremely plush and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and up to date. The flat screen tv was definitely nice to have in the room. The pool area was extremely family friendly. The pool was heated and the kiddie pool was a total plus for my little ones. Our family loved our stay at this location!

Reviews.Title: “Without the cookies, just another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ileana_SoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days while enjoying a stay-cation in San Diego. The hotel is conveniently located about 20 minutes from Sea World and the San Diego Zoo and there were plenty of restaurants, both high-end and casual, for easy meals. Entering the hotel's parking lot is slightly tricky, but if you miss the first driveway, you can turn at the next light and enter via the business park entrance. The front desk staff were a joy to deal with and everytime our kids walked up to the desk, they were readily presented with warm chocolate chip cookies (yummy). The hotel and our room were very clean, but I was disapointed with the lack of a safe in the room. Most rooms provide a safe, so I took it for granted that there would be one and I was sadly mistaken (lesson learned). I've read several reviews complaining about the thin walls, but I can't say that this was my experience. Additionally, we asked for a poolside room (which we received) and the view was great. Our kids could play in the pool while we watched them from the room. Speaking of the pool, it was great! It had plenty of room to move around, plus there was a small wading pool and a separate jacuzzi. Since the hotel is located within a business park, there weren't very many families staying here, so we didn't have to deal with a gaggle of screaming children. Don't get me wrong, we traveled with our kids, but they're older and I just don't have the patience for young, screaming kids. My only complaint (of the pool) is the landscaping. The jacuzzi sits right beside a huge palm tree that drops flowers and other matter into the water, making it difficult to soak without becoming covered in this stuff. My only other complaint, is the elevator situation. Both elevators have a rear door that is used by the cleaning staff. I am not above riding on an elevator with service staff, but I DO NOT appreciate being packed in like a sardine with 5 maids and their laundry carts. The elevators (comfortably) fit 5-9 adults (9 being on the generous side and only if you have no bags). As I rode down from the 4th floor, the elevator stopped at each floor and the maids ( who failed to use common sense) just kept shoving themselves in with their carts. I had to paste myself up against the wall to avoid having my feet rolled over by one of the carts. I appreciate efficiency and making the most of a space, but that should not come at the expense of guests. Our room rate included daily breakfast, which was pretty good. I can't say that the food was anything to brag about, but it was convenient and the servers were very attentive. Also, the free parking was great!! Most of the area hotels charge anywhere from $15-30 PER DAY for parking. Overall, I was happy, but without the cookies it's just any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/location. Terrible customer service in last & found dept”
Reviews.Author: Jen12343
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good front desk clerks, clean comfortable room, but we left our 2 expensive pillows..close to $200 for both, in our room and headed home back to AZ. Dealing with Deanna in the Lost and Found department was a nightmare!! She wanted to ship them but would not tell me how much. She just wanted a CC #. I was not comfortable giving that to her and have to wind up paying $50 to have my pillows shipped to me. We don't have that much money..sad, but true as is with many people now a days. So, I told her I'd try to find a friend that was heading to the area and have them come get them in the next few weeks. I found someone and called Deanna back to tell her (the 2nd week they were left there) and she got all mad and said that she needed to know what day my friend would be there and I told her that she was going to call me when she knew what day she could head over. Deanna said "well, I need to know what day she is coming. Thank you" and she hung up on me!! GREAT customer service! She also said that they could not hold things longer than 3 weeks. Well we were good on that time frame then. That was a week and a half ago. Today, I called to inform them that my friend would be by to get them this afternoon. And Deanna pretended that she didn't know who I was, and tried to tell me that I must have stayed at a different Double tree hotel..what the?? She continued to play stupid and said she would call me back. When she called back, she all of the sudden DID remember me but said that the pillows were shipped last week. I asked if they were shipped free of charge because I never gave a CC # and never consented to that. She said that someone called and gave a CC# I told her that no, in fact no one ever did and asked what the Fed X tracking # was and she said they could not find it. I said that they had never been shipped then. She again said she would call me back. Never heard from her called and talked to a manager..who said they would call me back and hung up w/o even taking down my phone number. I waited an hour and called back and called Deanna out on the fact that she was annoyed with me and therefore got rid of my pillows. She said again that they couldn't find them but they were shipped last week by Hannea at the front desk...RIGHT! She asked if I wanted them to send me 2 of their Down pillows and I said no, I want a check for my $200 pillows or a 2 night complimentary stay. She sounded shocked at the request, said she would talk to management and call me back. I would not stay here again just because of this, but if you don't plan on leaving anything in the room then the hotel was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: JayGott
Reviews.Content: We contacted the Doubletree for a very short notice banquet and they were EXTREMELY accomodating (as opposed to the Woodfin, which due to location, had been our first choice). Because of the timing of my fathers death we were hastily arranging his funeral for a Monday afternoon on the Friday afternoon beforehand. We tried the Woodfin first as they were closer to the funeral home, but when they didn't get back to me by Saturday at noon because "nobody from sales and catering was available till Monday morning," I called the Doubletree. Pinky at the front desk located the executive chef, Bob Kennedy, within 10 minutes. He was extremely accomodating and got us set up for Monday making a stressful situation very easy for us. Admittedly, I have not stayed at this hotel, but if their commitment to service is anything like I saw in this short notice situation, you would make a good decision if you stayed here (especially vs the Woodfin in Sorrento Valley!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Great Value...Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTravelGal
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here four times within the past 2 months and each time it just keeps getting better (thanks Ramaz & Barbara- great management...and Tim & Brandon for great shuttle service!). We've stayed both as a couple and with teenagers. We are very practical travellers and really like great value amenities as well as feeling like we are valued guests. If you look at my other reviews, you'll see that we look for practical amenities as well as great customer service. First of all, even though it's a "business center" location- who cares...it makes it less expensive and they have free shuttle service to approximately 4-6 miles. We love just parking- for free!- and never having to use our car 'til check out! THANK YOU TIM & BRANDON! You guys are awewome!! So, it's a given that we love the free shuttle. We also love the free cookies (thanks Barbara for always giving us extra!! :) as it saves us money from buying desserts- especially with teenagers in tow :) And they also provide free water bottles & apples which also saved us a little $$$ too (does eating apples cancel out the fat/calories from eating their decadent, sinfully delicious cookies????) The free parking is great and much appreciated. I've read several other hotel reviews and man oh man, hotel guests (myself included) HATE having to pay extra for parking. You'd think they'd get a clue! So kudos to DT DM for offering this nice perk! The best tip we got on our first visit was from our shuttle driver, Tim when he took us to Torrey Pines State Park in Del Mar (Conveniently located 1.5 miles away from the hotel). Ever since he introduced us to this gem (shame on me for being a SoCal native and never exploring the great hiking they offer here!) we go there every time we visit DT DM. A+++ The hotel is very nice & clean, but I really wish they'd enforce the no smoking outside the front doors. Fine if you wanna smoke, but please don't force me to get lung cancer by blowing your nasty smoke in my face! San Diego REALLY needs to follow San Luis Obispo, which I hear is like the first 100% smoke-free city!! Good for them; I hope other CA cities follow suit...for our health & children's health! Pool: First time we went, very cold water. The next few times, nicer & a bit warmer. They only have 1 jacuzzi and it's pretty much kid soup all the time (they could still heat it a little more in my opinion, but it's better than other pools I've been in). B-/C+ But they really need to put soap in the pool bathrooms, both the men/women's didn't have soap, YUCK! My only complaint (but it's w/ all hotels) is when these parents bring their little kids/infants in the jacuzzi. They need to have an adults only jacuzzi or 16+ and over (and enforce it). It's really hard to relax w/ screaming 'lil kids splashing water at you (or heaven forbid, pooping & shutting it down!). Rooms: First few times we got a one bed room in corner and it was really noisy (traffic), the last time we got two beds in room in better location which was way quieter, so that's what we'll be requesting from now on. Very clean, standard room. whhile comfy, I do wish their beds were bigger. It's really hard to get a good night sleep in a double bed. So from now on, even when travelling as a couple, we'll be getting the two bed room. Rooms: B/Beds: D Nice amentity: they'll accomodate you if you have special needs. I needed fridge/microwave for my meds (and they normally charge), but didn't charge me. I hate being nickel & dimed so this was very appreciated and another sign of great management! A+++ Housekeeping: Pretty good, they provide extra towel, replenish whatever you ask for, etc. A Business Center: Nice 'lil perk - even though there's only 2 computers- it's free & they let you print stuff for free. Wow, nice classy service. Way to make us feel valued! A+ Gym: Small, few machines/weights. We never used it, but there's a water cooler in there which is nice so you don't have to drink warm tap water (or just go to front desk & they give you free water bottles). C Overall, I think this hotel is best for: 1. Business Travellers 2. Practical couples who want great value/bang for their buck Note: July 2010 they're undergoing renovations of their restaurant area Special thanks to: Barbara- a total gem (hope your cut is healed!) Ramaz- what a gentleman, always calling us as we check in to ensure everything is to our satisfacation Tim- a very well mannered shuttle driver- total sweetheart Brandon- another great shuttle driver who's a total sweetheart We had less interaction with (but also positive experience): Tom & Kent Overall, this DT is very well managed. Every time we do our little SD escapes, this is the hotel we'll be seeking out to be staying at. We are LOYAL customers and have told all of our friends how wonderfully well we've always been treated (yes, the cookies do help! ha ha!). We expect to stay here several more times this year...and in upcoming years. If you have questions, feel free to ask. Have safe & happy travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good things, a few bad things”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We have previously stayed at the Marriott across the street, but preferred the Doubletree. Pros: Yummy cookies at check-in Extraordinarily friendly and helpful staff No parking fees No business center fees No resort fees Nice room with flat screen hotel We had a view of the pool and tropical garden instead of the air con system like we do when we stay at the Marriott Reasonably priced room service Cons: Don't care for the sliding bathroom door - hard to maneuver, especially late at night Took forever to pick up room service dishes that were left outside rooms - hours and hours - even after we called. Seems like it would attract insects or even rodents. This was pretty disgusting. How hard is it for the housekeeper or someone to make rounds a few times a day to pick up the trays? The location is in a business park and you really need a car if you stay here. It isn't far from either downtown San Diego (maybe 20 minutes driving) or the beaches up north. Aside from the few negative points above, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - 90% Excellent, 10% Ok”
Reviews.Author: Leigherton
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on June 19, 2010, staying one evening. I am a Silver Hilton Honors member and impressed by this beautiful hotel. I arrived early and was able to get to my room around 11:00 a.m. Tom, who was the front desk professional, helped me in this regard. Tom was also helpful in acknowledging my birthday that same day and gave me waters and cookies. He also helped coordinate a shuttle ride, I needed. My room was #506 and was clean and bright and overlooked the pool. I used the business center on two occasions and found it quiet and helpful. The pool area is very beautiful and relaxing too. This particular weekend was super busy because of the San Diego Fair. I was told that the shuttle driver was taking me directly to the Fairgrounds. Halfway through the ride, the driver, whose name I did not get, but he was a young man about 26, he informed me that he could not take me all the way to the Fairgrounds that he was dropping me off at a bus stop at the Horse Grounds and I would be driven by another bus to the Fair. That he had to get back to the hotel to drive other guests. It is a shame he couldn't have told me ahead of time. I was stressed out because he was truthful from the beginning. Otherwise I would have taken a cab. I am from Florida and am not familiar with this area. I ate breakfast the next morning in the restaurant. I had the buffet and it was okay, not great. Cynamon was very professional. Upon check out, Ramez was the front desk professional and helped me to my destination of Camino Road by driving the shuttle there. So kudos to Tom, Cynamon and Ramez for helping me in their fair city.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Service”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler32
Reviews.Content: We signed up for a room with two Queen beds. We got a room with one Queen bed and a sofa pull-out. We called down and were told there were no King beds or two queens available now but a room was being cleaned and we could get that; that we should leave our bags in the room and the luggage would be moved when we got back. We had to attend a function so when we got back 5 hours later; a little before 11pm, we checked with the front desk. Our things had not been moved and there was no obvious room available. The guy at the front desk hemmed and hawed and finally offered us two rooms. "Oh, you are married? " He said. "I guess then I can offer you a king size bed in the Junior Suite." So we dragged our own bags from our old room to the new room. Meanwhile, at the from desk I noticed that a woman with a small child who showed me her printed Expedia confirmation, was being held up by another front desk woman who had said she had no listed reservation despite the confirmation. She had actually called Expedia, been put on hold, left it on speakerphone at the front desk and walked into the backroom leaving the front desk unmanned for the whole time we were there. It was almost 11 at night and this poor woman and a child were being held up because of this. Poor form.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny room, very old bed”
Reviews.Author: Aquafam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend, so the hotel was fully booked and we were aware that our kids would have to share a sleeper sofa. We were however a little surpised to find that with the sleeper sofa open- it was pretty much wall- to - wall beds. Whoever was sleeping on the outside had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom since there was no walking room. This was definately the smallest hotel room we've ever stayed in. Also, the queen bed (not the sleeper sofa) was in need of a new mattress. It was so "sinky in the middle" that two people are very, very uncomfortable. The hotel was at least very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is there......but”
Reviews.Author: sl1953
Reviews.Content: This hotel has adhered utterly to the letter of the law in creating a wonderful visit. From the easy parking to the high ceiling entry and in and outdoor pools all will satisfied the traveler….. or will it? The Bar alone will harbor 75 visitors and the elegant restaurant just across draws one endlessly to drink from its bounty and linger into the night with conversation. For those looking for the best made industrial resting spot, you have arrive at your destination. But it’s not how great it looks but how it makes you feel. It’s the spirit of the place. The warm attentive reception, the energy in the bar, the uplifting of the spirit and anticipation of a lovely experience. The latter weary travelers need not apply here but those needing to look good rather than feel good, enter her gates with joy.

Reviews.Title: “Rude receptionist but excellent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelkool
Reviews.Content: Nice grounds, nice pool. Front-desk receptionist Marianna was smug, very rude, and began to speak in another language to herself when she was upset that we wanted a handicap accessible room. Otherwise, great value. Besides the Marianna experiecnce, this 3 star seemed like 3 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “beds too small for tall people”
Reviews.Author: Travelinmom07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine in a lot of respects. Clean, very nice pool area, easy access from the highway and close to Mission Bay. They were in the process of painting the dining area which was fine really. The breakfast is pretty pricey at 15 bucks per person - go to the Denny's that is near by. The air conditioner worked but was on some kind of timer so we woke up in the middle of the night because it was hot. Also the comforters are down which would be very nice if it was cold outside, but really in San Diego you just don't need down. Biggest problem was the size of the bed. They claim it was a Queen, but there is just no way that it was. It was a full . My husband is 6'6" and the bed was too short and not wide enough for both of us. I felt like I was sleeping on the edge of the mattress all night and so did he. We will not stay there again because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Great!”
Reviews.Author: GymTraveler21
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights, for a sports competition and it was fantastic. Because the hotel was accosiated with the competition, we got free breakfast (which had great food) and a discount on the nightly rate. The rooms were very clean and organized, and the tv was very nice. We got plenty of channels and were thouroughly entertained when we weren't at the competition. It was very close to the beach and Torrey Pines state park. The only cons I have, are that its a tad bit far from the San Diego Airport, but it wasn't too bad. Also, the dinner was a bit expensive, and it took about 45 minutes to make a ceasar salad. But overall, this was a GREAT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Pricelinejunkie00
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family in the San Diego area. Had switched from the Marriott Courtyard Central at the identical AAA rate because the pictures of the pool looked so darn enticing. The pool is exactly as billed and we had a terrific day. Compared with the Courtyard Central, the rooms are smaller (no balcony) and the hotel is bigger and busier. The cookies were abundant and amazing, but breakfast / wifi are not included. Considering the rate was the same, we should have stayed at the Courtyard Central but still had a decent stay at the Doubletree Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable And Less Than Honest”
Reviews.Author: racine
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot -- worldwide. Have never encountered anything like this and we generally like where we stay hotel wise. We booked a multi-night stay through Hotels.com that included breakfast. I had the print out of the reservation stating that the rate included the breakfast buffet. It's not a hotel I would have chosen without it, as it's in an industrial park and a bit of a drive from the sites we wanted to get to in La Jolla and MB. They had a decent rate and it looked ok, so we thought we'd try it. The front desk clerk and the manager of the hotel refused to honor the rate because "it was too low of a rate for them to do it." ?!? They were rude and uncooperative. Phoned Hotels.com to enforce the rate. They called and were unable to get the mgt. to cooperate. Haggled with them for 2 days and then called Hilton Honors. Someone up the food chain finally slapped them up side the head and got them to comp the breakfasts we were entitled to. BTW, couldn't ck out because we had paid in advance and it was non-refundable. They really had us. Hilton Honors and Hilton Mgt. was superb in their customer service and communication. Will stay at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla or another chain in Del Mar before coming back here -- better location, better breakfast, nicer rooms and better service for about the same price. Ridiculous that I should have to spend one minute of my vacation with rude staff who are intentionally breaching a contract because they're too cheap to honor it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, and serviceable hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLMChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: As my business in San Diego was in North County, the Doubletree Hotel San Diego/Del Mar made for a very convenient location, and turned out to be a very satisfying stay. Room, bath were comfortable, with a nice pool view. I enjoyed sitting out on the terrace, nibbling on some delicious and reasonably priced snacks. The pool and garden setting is landscaped lovely, and makes for a nice respite. While the hotel lacks self-service laundry, the helpful staff was able to advise me of nearby venue, plus Radio Shack, local restaurants and a Supercuts. This was my second visit, and I will gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but expensive and beware of 2nd floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: nanilo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in early Feb 2010. The hotel itself is beautiful, but expensive. The rooms, landscaping, and personnel were all very nice. There is a small resturaunt that serves wonderful food, but the hotel is within walking distance to a mall with a bunch of other restuaunts. Let me start off by saying that I have never had to change hotel rooms during any hotel stay. My huge gripe was regarding my room. I checked in around 9PM and was placed on the 2nd floor near the elevators. The floor to the room vibrated as if there was some sort of ceiling fan on the floor below. I was extremely loud, frequent, but sporatic. By 10:30 PM I couldn't take it any longer and told them then while I was already unpacked for tonight that 1st thing in the morning I would need to change rooms. When I went down the next day to change rooms there was a list of people who called and complained about the noise because the front desk person referred to a list taped to the phone. My new room was still on the 2nd floor. The vibrating noise was not as loud and the floor did not physically move, but I could still hear the noise. Later that day, I saw they had placed another customer into the room I vacated earlier. I couldn't believe that someone else would have to endure that noise/vibration so I voiced my concern to the new front desk person. She said that they knew about the issue and it was a problem with the elevators and they were considering converting the rooms into conference rooms. I told her that they should fix the problem and NOT place people paying good money into those problematic rooms. She just shrugged her shoulders. I could not believe that no one from the corporate Hilton office is aware of this issue! This speaks very poorly for Hilton quality and I strongly feel if they were aware of the situation, it would be resolved. I placed a complaint with Hilton and am awaiting a call from the site manager. So while the hotel was nice, until they resolve the 2nd floor elevator/room issue, I would not recommend this hotel unless you can obtain a room on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value! Immaculate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EgyptianHeidi
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel, only a mile or two from Del Mar beach. When first approaching we were a little discouraged that it was in a corporate office area right off of the highway. But once you step inside, you are warmly greeted with a chocolate chip cookies which makes everything better! :-) The rooms are decorated very nice! We had a view of the pool which was also pleasant (and not noisy). The rooms are stocked with Neutrogena cosmetics (including sunscreen!), and there is a Wolfgang Puck coffee machine which is nice. There is a really nice pool that is quite relaxing too. We booked on Priceline and paid $52 - bargain! For breakfast we simply drove to the beach for coffee and bagels because the breakfast prices at the hotel were a bit cha-ching.

Reviews.Title: “Good hospitality near Torrey Pines”
Reviews.Author: smokedmeat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, December 4. Reserved one room with Priceline at the nightly rate of $45 USD. I was specifically looking for a hotel in the Del Mar area and expected this hotel to be the one that I would get. After sightseeing in Los Angeles and Anaheim, my friend and I arrived in San Diego in the evening. The desk clerk was very helpful in checking us in and gave us each a traditional Doubletree chocolate chip cookie which was still warm! The double room (543) was quite modern and luxurious. There were five pillows on each bed, and the flat screen TV and Wolfgang Puck coffee maker made for a high-class atmosphere. However, the bathroom was very run down. There was only a sliding door that didn't lock, while the towel rack couldn't support the weight of two sets of towels and was already sagging off the wall anchors. I thought that there would be complimentary Internet at the hotel, but it wasn't to be found in the rooms. High speed wireless connections were available for $9.95 a day, but for free Internet you had to go to the business center. There were two terminals there with access available 24 hours a day. Located close to the highway, there isn't much to do within walking distance. Parking is free, and it is essential to have a car if staying here. For dinner, we ventured to the nearby Souplantation (3804 Valley Center Drive) by accident while driving through some business parking lots. The salad, soup and pasta buffet was a good change from the fast food I had for most of the trip. A quick drive across the freeway leads you to the coast, including the Pacific Ocean and the Torrey Pines State Beach. I drove a little further to check out the Torrey Pines Golf Course.
