I plan on playing the South Course ($218 USD visitor rate) someday, but it will have to be on a return trip. If I do come back to play Torrey Pines, I would not hesitate to book a room at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like I was on Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ImluckyRN11
Reviews.Content: Doubletree in Del Mar has a great pool / jacuzzi - My room was located on the first floor with a view of the pool area. Although I was here on business, I felt like I was at a resort in Hawaii. Breakfast buffet was included with the room. Restaurant is excellent! Room service was quick. Room was large, updated and well appointed. Free parking and internet. Easy access to freeway and short drive to San Diego sights!

Reviews.Title: “Good service - overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dairbear
Reviews.Content: We paid more than we wanted to when we booked this hotel. On arrival we ended up with a king size and a pull out sofa - not what we booked. We were told that thats what the booking company had ordered (after talking to them once home, they disputed this) and that they were over-booked for double-double rooms. So we stayed there that night, and moved the next day. They gave us a free breakfast. (enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts better at HIE and LA Qunita! - certainly wouldve been ticked off if I'd paid the $15 each). Unfortunately we had to move the next day again due to noisy neighbours in the early hours of the morning. The rooms were ok - could've done with a refrigerator - nice tvs, half decent shower but we'd had comfier beds elsewhere. The facilities were good however, with a decent pool, hot tub and well laid out outdoor area and the business centre was good. Didnt use the gym but it looked in good condition. Nothing much in the area, but we did expect that. We were also disappointed with the amount of thick dense fog that managed to make its way to the beach areas - we were told this was normal for the San Diego area. We were disappointed with San Diego as a whole - except for the Zoo, that was really great. Maybe we'd just built our expectations too high? This sounds like a whiny, complaining review, which is not something that I do very often as being scottish, I tend to just get annoyed and not say anything. I think this hotel was overpriced, was banking on the DoubleTree name and the facilities to get it through. Lovely staff though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay for 2 People and 1 Child”
Reviews.Author: mom22boyz
Reviews.Content: I took my young sons (2 & 8) to Legoland and needed a place to stay for a few nights. I got a great rate with Priceline.com for this hotel which was located about 20 minutes away from the park. While it is located in a business park, there are a lot of amenities very close by including a shopping plaza within walking distance (but up a short hill). Public beaches in Del Mar are very close by and the hotel is right off the freeway. The hotel was clean and safe and the rooms were as well. I believe the majority of the rooms are set up with one queen bed and a sofabed with very, very few doubles or kings (if they have any at all). So the maximum comfort load in a room would be 2 adults (sharing a queen) and kids who are willing to sleep on a sofabed (my oldest thought it was cool). If Dad had come it would have been really tight for space though. They have an outdoor pool that the boys loved. The front desk staff weren't any more than cordial though. They didn't seem to care about being overly customer service-oriented. But we didn't need a lot from them so it wasn't a big deal. We didn't order room service and there isn't a regular restaurant there (only open certain times) but that was okay b/c there are plenty of restaurants in Del Mar to choose from and a kid-oriented one up the hill (Pat and Oscar's where kid's eat free on certain days). They allow pets which is great for pet owners but it was a little disconcerting to have my children ride an elevator with a strange dog. I believe they only put the animals on certain floors so it won't be an issue for those with allergies. I'd stay here again when visiting the north county of San Diego as I found this locale to be conveniently located but only if it were me and the two kids and I got the great rate I did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Wrknmom-of2
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. It was located in a very nice area and so close to the beach. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. After a long day at Sea World and the beach, our family relaxed in the hotel's very nice pool and hot tub. We will definitely stay again the next time we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: bennyray
Reviews.Content: You can tell this hotel has changed ownership. It is the little things that are getting neglected. I still love the location and still love the hotel, the pool is the best. But it is not worth the price anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- and got a great price!”
Reviews.Author: mi_1204
Reviews.Content: Living near LA, my family and I were originally planning to visit friends in San Diego on Saturday for a day at the beach and drive back that night. My wife suggested we make a weekend out of it. I started to look into hotels, but San Diego hotels are so overpriced on Saturday nights. We went on Priceline.com and put in a bid for $50. We were surprised when our bid was accepted. Even more suprised to find out the hotel we got was a Hilton Doubletree- and to book the same room at Hilton's website was $165! So we really lucked out. Location of the hotel is near Del Mar off the 5 Fwy. It's more in a business area than a tourist area. We were able to check in early. Nothing spectacular about our room- average size with 2 queen beds and view of the parking lot. But at least it was clean and the beds were comphy! For $50 on a summer Saturday night in San Diego- we can't complain. We ended up us getting free breakfast buffets for the next morning, and enjoyed their very nice pool. We would stay here again! So definetely try Priceline and you might get a good rate here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for weekend relaxation and pool time”
Reviews.Author: SusieGirl7
Reviews.Content: What I loved most about the hotel was the pool. It's quite large and t-shaped, so the kids tend to splash in one area, leaving plenty of room for others to swim laps or just swim lazily around the pool. There is also a jacuzzi and a kids wading pool. Plus lots of lounge chairs for relaxing. There are warm towels by the pool, changing rooms and you can even order food to eat poolside. It seemed like you could also sit outside, by the restaurant and just enjoy the day if that's what you felt like doing. In our 2 night stay, we went to the pool 5 times, we loved it that much. The hotel is in a quiet area of town but just minutes from all the attractions. If you're spending your time in the La Jolla area, you couldn't ask for more. Even downtown is just 15 minutes away. The hotel in a business park, so the area is silent on the weekends. There is a strip mall nearby with a Vons (Starbucks, Jamba and Panda inside) and a few places to eat - very convenient. Got the hotel on Priceline so our rate was amazing. We had a room with 2 queen beds, so there was plenty of room for everyone. We also had free wifi in the room. Haven't seen others mention it so it must be new. Very happy with it. Also enjoyed the fitness center - again, not crowded during the weekends. This is a great hotel for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Hostile Customer Services / Ghost Hotel Manager”
Reviews.Author: laportetroite
Reviews.Content: August 2009 This hotel looks respectable from the outside, but don't let that fool you. We called to confirm our reservation the day before arrival and was connected to a rambling phone attendant. This "old" woman could barely enunciate English, together w/ her hostile tonation gave us a real laugh. When we repeatedly asked her to transfer our call to the front desk, she said she is the front desk and when we asked to speak w/ the hotel manager, she said there was not one available and said "you have to deal w/ me". This strange and semi-terrorist conduct from this hotel's hired employees surely puts us on guard! We know that there is a current contraction w/ the global economy, but this certainly falls of the rocker to getting travelers to spend for services. At best, this hotel is a front for some Halloween house intended to intimidate paying guests. At worst, they employ unqualified people to run the business into the ground. Who do you call ? Not the hotel manager of their customer service dept. in Dallas, TX. One plays ghost, and the other will surely jive over your head with their overmedicated and undereducated talks.

Reviews.Title: “Far Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Martinvan
Reviews.Content: This place is not what was described on the internet listing or what I was told over the telephone. I was a single traveler staying for several days to enjoy horseracing at Del Mar. The hotel looks nice, but the service is terrible. I was told over the phone that I could get a free schuttle to the track, but in the morning I was told those are "only for wedding parties." My room was nice. I was able to see the same dirt on the carpet every morning of my stay. I guess they don't vacuum. I ordered room service and it never came, twice! The female bartender was just nasty. I understand you need to talk to your friend on your cell, but could you get me the drink first? I also read that there would be cookies. Never saw any of them. When I checked out, I told the hotel clerk that my stay was terrible, he offered me a free night at the hotel. Why would I want to stay? There is a Hampton and a Marriott across the street. I don't know if they are any better, but I would consider them first next year when I visit Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: shel312
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a good hotel. Rooms were clean, pool was beautiful. Bathroom door was weird--a pocket door that was very hard to open and close. My 9 year old couldn't open it on several occasions. The one thing I didn't like was the location. Yes, it is very close driving distance to everything--beaches, downtown, attractions. The hotel itself is in an industrial park, so there is nothing within close walking distance. We usually like to walk around and see the area at night and there was nothing to see here except business centers. Made me feel as if I was on a business trip, not a vacation. Also, there were a lot of dogs as another reviewer said. At first I didn't mind, but then when I had to share the elevator with a huge irish setter breathing on my leg, then I thought twice about the dogs! Hotel itself very nice--wish it were in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, central location, what a wonderful week!”
Reviews.Author: AndeaAnderson
Reviews.Content: we were able to get a deal: approx $100/night the week before 4th of july. i was impressed with all the service, from housekeeping to room service to front desk. the room was on the non-pool view side, spacious, quiet; the only time i heard anyone was just little kids in the hallway one evening. the sheets and towels, beds and shower--all wonderfully relaxing! the huge wonderful pool was perfect; even when the pool was crowded, it didn't seem crowded! restaurant was nothing special. ordered room service quite a bit; it was expensive but super fast and at the correct temperature. i'd recommend the del mar doubletree to anyone who wants a nice family-friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near the fair!”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Doubletree in June of 2009 with my girlfriend when visiting from Vegas. We booked the room on Priceline for $69 + tax, which was a great deal for the area. It wasn't exactly in Del Mar, but it was very close and the hotel had a free shuttle that took us to the fair. Of course the cookies are great at the front desk. My only real complaint was that the room had a queen sized bed and not a king. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and the Pool was great.”
Reviews.Author: vastdavidson
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Warm cookie on check-in was just what the kids needed after 5 hours on a plane. Check-in was quick and easy. Staff couldn't be better. Only fault is the kiddy pool was cold. But the rest of the pools were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “All Dogs Go To... The Doubletree??”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice now. Both times have been fine. Of course you get the tasty chocolate chip cookie. I like free parking. Rooms are comfy. The rooms are small-ish though. The bed has enough space to walk at the foot of it. Because the coffee table is there. Beyond that is a couch. Don't get me wrong, it's nice to have a couch, but the location isn't the greatest. The couch blocks access to open & close the curtains, and to the thermostat. Bathroom is adequate sized. Nice Neutrogena toiletries including face wash & a small tube of sunblock. The parking can be tight. What I decided is that as you pull in if you look for the perpendicular line that goes along the aisle those spots seemed to be smaller. Head toward the far side of the lot on the freeway side, or actually on the side of the hotel, and the spots are a bit wider. The narrower spots aren't awful, but if you need to un-load items from the backseat of your vehicle it's tight and you have to be really careful not to hit the neighboring car. If you don't have the additional insurance on a rental car I'd avoid these spots because of other drivers around you. There were a TON of dogs! I like dogs, but wow. I swear every time during the weekend that I was going in or out someone was taking their dog(s) out for a walk. On Sunday morning all I could hear in my hallway were barking dogs. At times the music in the hallways was a bit on the loud side. Didn't help that they played a lot of Top 40-ish stuff. During our stay, on Sunday I believe (checked out on Tuesday), one of the elevators broke. The elevator situation wasn't the greatest to begin with for the number of rooms and with one down it was awful. For some reason you had to hold the button on the 1st floor to get the elevator down. 224 rooms, which were mostly full on the weekend due to a kids soccer tournament, one elevator was just awful. Plus the elevator was on the small side. Comfy bed. Good location for what we were in the area for. Good freeway access. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous pool, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lwu22qq
Reviews.Content: I can say with complete confidence that we were 100% impressed with this hotel from check in to check out. Hotel staff were superb, rooms were bright, well finished, and very clean. Even though the hotel charges for Internet, I was able to get free WiFi. Pool is amazing, in a quiet area with lots of trees. Hotel features a very large and odd shaped outdoor pool, and both a wake pool and hot tub. Bathroom is modern and like the rest of the facility very clean. The only complaint I have is the fitness room was not very well vented which meant I was sweating bullets.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Comfortable, Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: bsbruce
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel of choice in the Del Mar area. The staff is just great and goes out of their way to make you feel important. The rooms are well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: kristilyn1
Reviews.Content: $50 on Priceline's name your own price. But I would have the same things to say even if it was full price. We only stayed one night but we found it very convenient for us and the hotel was very nice. The room was spacious, the staff pleasant and helpful and the kids loved the pool. We've pricelined rooms in the past and are always happy with what we get and this was no exception. It only took us 15 mins. to get here from downtown and we would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to avoid the high downtown prices or be convenient for other things in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JoeBruin1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 30 minutes north of downtown and a few miles east of Torrey Pines. It is in a convenient location, closed to the 5 and 805 freeway merge. The front counter staff was really helpful, courteous and professional. The room that I got was clean and nicely furnished. The bed and sheets were clean. The bed was very comfortable. I would have loved to sleep in, but I had an early meeting (the bed was really nice). Although the property is located next to a busy street, the insulation is sufficient and you will not hear street noise. The only problem with the hotel was that they did not have free wi-fi. This really puzzled me since the hotel is close to San Diego businesses and the most common guests were business travelers. It would have been nice if they did not charge $9.95 for the service. Supposedly they have free wi-fi in the lobby, but the signal was so slow and intermittent, I would just wait until I got to the office to do my work. If not for the wi-fi service, I would have rated the Double Tree "excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: celkiar04
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for one night before moving into my new apartment. The staff was super nice. We only had one little hiccup when our room wasn't ready because it was being painted. They gave us a new room right away and complimentary breakfast tickets to make up for the inconveince. Breakfast was delicous! The hotel was clean, beds comfy, and very pleasant to say in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blitz12
Reviews.Content: Great location, good pool area and comfortable beds. It was very clean and the rooms were just right. Check-in was easy and the service was great. I loved how easy it is to find and how close it is to everything in San Diego. The beach was only minutes away. Overall great hotel. Can't say enough about the beds in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area, fantastic customers service, and loved the "sweet dream" bed”
Reviews.Author: teena192
Reviews.Content: Priceline (name your own price) $65 bucks. Can't beat that deal in San Diego. Stayed at this hotel Sunday and Monday for Labor Day weekend '08. Loved the pool area. It had a large main pool, nice size spa, and a kiddie pool for the children. Customer service was unbeatable!!! Free convenient parking (which is always nice in San Diego). Room service was offered until 11PM and was delivered very quickly. Amazing "Sweet Dream" bed!!! Lots of towels in bathroom. Pretty much a great hotel for the price I paid. I noticed that the hotel was very pet friendly for those of you taking your little doggies. Would stay here again on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but LOUD JUNIOR SUITE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: tabano5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in San Diego with 2 kdis (1 and 3) and LOVED the hotel. Great pool, especially the 1 foot deep kiddy pool, LOVED the bed, ultra soft and cozy and the staff was really polite and seemed to make accomodating us a priority. Be sure and ask for a welcoming back-pack for the little ones, it includes all sorts of fun toys and a frisbee if you can believe that! (Who gives a kid a frisbee in a HOTEL ROOM!?) They loved it though. The one major downsdie to this hotel, and we had a junior suite, was the noise from one room to the other. Luckily our neighbors were also watchign the Olympics, and we all seemed to go to sleep at the same time... but alas he was up at 4 AM and we heard EVERYTHING... his phone call, his TV... it was a nightmare. We complained and asked them to please keep the room empty for our second night, but of course, they didn't. Why they would put a junior suite across from the elevator and with thin walls seems ... well... you pay a little more to get more, but it didn't feel that way. All in all though, the bed was PURE HEAVEN, and pool is great, just be sure and ask for a QUIET ROOM and you will be very pleased. A solid 3 star hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: goshan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great in all aspects. It's close by to everything San Diego has to offer (downtown - 29 minutes, Coronado - 25 minutes, SeaWorld - 15 minutes, La Jolla - 15 minutes, Torrey Pines - 10 minutes, Legoland - 15 minutes). The hotel is located close to the Interstate 5, but it's just far enough from the highway that you are not even aware that it is nearby. The pool is good even though we did not spend too much time there (only once when we arrived) - there are just too many good things around San Diego to be in a pool. The room was spacious, clean, and well decorated. We had to use a room that had only one king-size bed (we were travelling with two children (4 and 8)) as the room with two double beds was not available. However, the room had a pull-out couch which suited our kids just fine. One final note - the parking is complimentary and was always available (the parking lot was quite big). To sum it up: I definitely recommend a stay here if you are heading to San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: azdunbars
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. AC worked great. Friendly staff, and good cookies. Breakfast was too expensive, but smelled great. Close to most attractions (with in 15-20 minutes) Would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lurch1
Reviews.Content: Clean - slightly upscale hotel. Staff was curtious, free warm welcome chocolate chip cookies,. Room was basic - 2 queens, desk, dressor, 27" TV, w payperview movies and wireless game controller. Beds were extremely soft and comfy. Located only 2-3 miles north of 5/805 split and at most 12-13 miles north of Downtown. I would recommend this especially on weekends as it is a business hotel and fairly quiet and easy to get rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Quiet & Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: bellastella96
Reviews.Content: I stayed here right at the end of May and had absolutely no problems! The check-in staff were incredibly courteous even though it was late when I checked in and I received a warm chocolate chip cookie. The room was clean and nice, with a great pool view. The bed was soft and comfy and I appreciated the Neutrogena products. Check out was a breeze too. All in all, it's a nice and peaceful hotel and I really enjoyed my stay. Oh, and I appreciated the free WiFi in the lobby as well as the free printing and computer usage in the business center since my husband always brings his laptop.

Reviews.Title: “All I expected from a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul518
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Checked in after midnight and they still had cookies for us (even warm). Gave us free bottles of water. A typical upper-end (not a Four Seasons) *business* hotel. I would not stay here for a fun trip. Room was fine with good bed, nice bathroom and decent amenities. Window opened so i could get fresh air. My only complaint is that I could hear the person next door talking on the phone through the connecting door. And, with the window open, I could clearly hear the freeway. Would I stay there again? Sure. Not excellent, but decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Price, Good location”
Reviews.Author: amandab97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the subrubs of San Diego. SInce we were visiting a friend in University City, we wanted to be close to him yet accessible to all the sights in SD. Teh Doubletree was wonderful! The area has developed so there are more restaurants and coffee shops around, although there are still many office buildings. It is right on the highway so we didn't have to deal with much traffic and getting in and out was fine. The Doubletree rooms were well kept and maintained, the beds are wonderful! We sat in the hot tub almost every night, not many takers in late December for an outdoor hot tub, but it was warm and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: AVMinnesotaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights there as part of our family vacation to the San Diego area and we had a great experience at this hotel. Everything was very clean and felt relatively new. Very nice pool and workout facilities. Very convenient to local attractions, including La Jolla, the beach and Torrey Pines. Convenient shopping and restaurants nearby. Great for adults and kids. I highly recommend. (fyi, we paid the std internet rate, somewhere around $140). Only minor complaint is there is a lot of traffic noise sitting by the pool as it is very near a couple of busy roads.

Reviews.Title: “A-OK Hotel but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: hjmover
Reviews.Content: I landed this hotel via Priceline at a bid of $52.00. The hotel web rate was $139.00. The hotel is located near the 5 and 56 freeways so its very convenient to alot of tourist locations like Torrey Pines State Park. Importantly, this hotel is located near a business park. There is a Marriott and Hampton Inn across the street. I checked in on a Friday afternoon. There was a little bit of a wait but the clerk was friendly upon check-in. Priceline was mentioned when I asked for a room on a high floor that was quiet. Fortunately, I did get a warm cookie. I was given Room 355 which is down a long hallway and with a view of the business park and the 56 freeway. I could hear car noise when sitting near the window. So the clerk was friendly but really did not honor my request. The lobby area is relatively small. They have a gift shop right next to the front desk that sells soda and munchies. It is nothing special. Off of the lobby was a bar, restaurant, and meeting rooms. Down the first floor hallway was the pool area, fitness center, and business center. The pool area was nicely designed although one hears traffic from the 5 and 56 freeways. The fitness room was equipped with a bunch of aerobic equipment and free weights. The aerobic equiptment had small tv's which made the work out go faster. There were free weights to use but no weight machines. My room was adequate but nothing special. The room came with one queen bed, a desk, and a couch. There were two telephones but no refrigerator, mini-bar or microwave. I don't see it as a family friendly hotel. Also, one pays $9.95 to access the internet. On the plus side parking is free. The bathroom was nice with Neutrogena products. Towels were fluffly and soft. I thought it was strange the bathroom door was a track that you had to roll to close. It did not roll very smoothly and made the door hard to close. It was kind of a weird set-up. The hotel offers room service. Prices were expensive so I walked up the street to the local supermarket. They had lots of prepared foods so it was easy to grab a plate of food and walk back to my room. There were other food places in this mall including nicer restaurants as well as Subway like places. Overall, I cannot complain about my stay especially with the Priceline rate -- but this would not be a hotel I would rush back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DoubleEagleDave
Reviews.Content: We just finished a great mini-vacation with my wife and 5-year old grandson. Great facility. Close to the I-5 freeway. Twenty minutes from the Airport. Close to the beach. We went to Legoland (15 minutes), Disneyland (an hour and 15 minutes) and Sea World (15 minutes). Staff was great. Bar (which I needed after a hard day a Disney with a 5-year old) was excellent. Clean facility. Lots of business travelers, but very customer-friendly for families. Pool and hot tub were great. Made for a great mini-vacation! I recommend this place highly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: JesApe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Del Mar over President's Day weekend. The hotel is mostly business focused and is located near freeways, in a business park setting. However, we found the location convenient for traveling amongst the various, area attractions, such as La Jolla and Torrey Pines State Reserve. The hotel itself was nice, clean, and comfortable, with the standard Doubletree cookies at check-in. We had a room overlooking the pool and marsh, which was very nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Parking was plentiful and free. We discovered at check-in that the hotel only have a few rooms (four, I believe) with king-size beds, despite the website listings. Most guests will receive a queen size bed at check-in, even if they requested / booked a king. Also, internet access from the room is only available for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Doubletree Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: girlagogo
Reviews.Content: Great deal in December. I have never stayed at a Doubletree before, and frankly, I was a bit afraid! (Fairmont and Ritz, yes, but what is a Doubletree?) It was great. Free Parking. Great cookie w/ check in. Great location. Beds were decent. Not 5 star, but really comfortable. Rooms were clean. Maid service wonderful. No, we didn't have the beds turned down in the late afternoon, nor were bathrobes provided, but it was a delightful cheap and cheerful vacation, and I would do it again in a heartbeat! I actually liked the fact you could "do your thing" at the hotel without having to interface w/ alot of employees~ A great stay and I will not hesitate to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: chargersfan34
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the I-5, near to Del Mar and near to restaurants/supermarkets if you want to stay local. Buffet breakfast was good, attentive staff, bar ok, room was clean, spacious and the bed was super comfy. Don't stay here if you are on vacation as it is away from the Del Mar/San Diego attractions but for a business traveller, I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at a Doubletree/Hilton again!”
Reviews.Author: calitravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This whole hotel is a facade. The lobby is nice, but that is where it ends. When I entered the room, the paint on the door was peeling off(why there was paint on the door was beyond me). The floor was hard and felt like I was walking on concrete. The bathroom door is not like a normal door. It slides into the wall, like a closet door. That is fine and good, except ours was stuck in the wall and you could not close it. The beds were lumpy and hard, and the wallpaper was peeling. The glasses for the water were not clean. Most importantly, the window was broken, and we were on the 3rd floor. I checked out immediately, and demanded a full refund. The girls at the front desk were accommodating, and said my credit card would not be charged. A couple of days later, I still saw a hold on my account from this hotel for more than my actual stay would have been. When I contacted the hotel manager to help me with this matter, he was rude and yelling at me, saying MY bank was scum. I wound up staying at the Marriott across the street and they are 100 times better, and for the same price the Doubletree charges! I plead to anyone who reads this, do not stay at any Doubletree or Hilton brand hotel. The price of this particular hotel is the same as others in the area, and you will get much much more for your money at any other hotel. I hate to have anyone spend their hard earned money and be treated with such terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoying staying here”
Reviews.Author: ainahou
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our third stay at this hotel. Our room was on the top floor where there is some construction but it didn't interfere at all with the stay. The bed was super comfortable and the room and bath clean and pretty. There is a 4-6pm happy hour with $2 drinks and inexpensive snacks by the pool, and a Starbucks a short walk away. It is also near a shopping center with food store, small restaurants, etc. We stay here because it is usually available through Priceline (Del Mar area) for $65-$75 plus taxes--thus a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ricardofr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the right place to be when you go to San Diego. 20 minutes from downtown, 4 or 5 minutes from the beach! The staff was very nice and they gave us cookies when we check in. The garden is beautiful and the swimming pool are nice and they are open until 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mainetoday
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to San Diego from Palm Springs and were planning to go to the San Diego Wild Animal Park the following morning. We stumbled upon this hotel after finding out that all the hotels in La Jolla were booked on a Wed. night. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised. Although they did have a nice looking pool area, we didn't have time to use it. We did partake in the 1/2 price drinks during happy hour at the lounge and used their complimentary business center to get caught up on a few things. Also, we ended up going to a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse down the street later that night and the shuttle bus driver gave us a ride there and back, no charge... The hotel looks like it was currently being updated as the hallways had brand new carpeting and wallpaper, it had the new smell. The room itself was very clean and bright. This would seem to be a perfect hotel to stay at if in town for business, very convenient to I-5 and other highways. We would definately stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: radis
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet hotel, nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: psdabj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a Thursday and Friday night with a great Priceline rate of $80.00. The front desk was very accommodating and gave us a room with 2 queens instead of the 1 queen with a pullout couch that we should have gotten with our Priceline bid. Our 2nd floor room faced the pool and we never had a problem with noise. I asked for a refrigerator and one was delivered immediately and for no charge. This is in a good location if you have a car. It is about a 5 min drive to Del Mar Beach and just about a 15 min drive to La Jolla. The parking is free, which was nice. There is only one restaurant within walking distance, the Tio Leo’s Mexican Restaurant. It had very good food and margaritas. My son enjoyed the Jacuzzi and pool area. The Internet was not working in their business center, so they gave us free, in -room Internet for the morning. I would recommend this hotel, especially for the price I paid, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Clean, Quiet, Comfortable. Very nice and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Pumula
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access to freeways, so it's easy to get to the beaches, shopping, sightseeing, etc. There is a shopping center with a Star Bucks and a Von's 2 minutes away. Probably one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in! The beds are heavenly. Don't waste money on the King Jr. Suite unless you like hearing the elevator and everyone that comes off it 24/7 tho. The staff were all Fantastic, very friendly, always smiling. Nice Pina Colada's out by the pool. The breakfast buffett is awsome, but I'd suggest skipping the room service, I was here two weeks and ordered several times and was consistently dissappointed. Otherwise it's a great find and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: kitkat77
Reviews.Content: We have been pleased everytime we stay here...booked all our rooms through Priceline and have gotten rooms for $75-$90 over the past year. Hotel is very clean and located in a residential area of Del Mar. Freeway access is great! The rooms are very comfortable and the staff is friendly! We really like being away from the hustle bustle of other hotels further south!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to roam around San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: vanillachick7
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful relaxing week and got to do and see quite a few things,since this hotel is just north of San Diego airport by 15 min. We were able to go to a couple Padre games, the naval park and the seaport village shopping area. Then there's the smaller residential areas all around on the coast like LaJolla where you can walk along near the ocean where we saw baby sea lions and their mothers sun bathing on the beach. We also went to the Barona Casino up in the mountains only about an hour from the hotel with spectacular scenery. It was amazing that you could go from the sea right up into the mountains in such a short span. We booked a Jr. Suite which included a large sitting area, business desk set-up and refrigerator. There's a shopping plaza within walking distance. The pool is beautiful and you would never know a major highway was just on the other side. I even saw humming birds there.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Hotel San Diego/Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 11915 El Camino Real, San Diego, CA 92130-2539
